page.title: 02SOLID GEOLOGY IN LAMLASH.
page.content: Lamlash is mostly composed of Dune Bedded Sandstone and Breccia.These are sediments from the Permian age.The secondary rock type is Crinatite with some Teschenite sills.These are igneous intrusions which came from the Tertiary age.These make up the higher areas of Lamlash due to them being of a more resistant rock type whereas the dune bedded sandstone and breccia are softer sediments which were eroded more easily . There are some scattered Felsite dykes,sills and vent intrusions,the most notable of these being Meall Buidhe which reaches a height of 261metres.There are a number of small thin dykes that are visible only on the beach.These dykes are an extrusive rock,commonly known as Basalt.
